parameter.name: user_data

parameter.name: user_data2
parameter.parameter_description: The user data of the signal (ignored)

enum.name: GstMpegtsStreamType
enum.description:
Type of mpeg-ts stream type.
These values correspond to the base standard registered types. Depending on the variant of mpeg-ts being used (Bluray, ATSC, DVB, ...), other types might also be used, but will not conflict with these.
Corresponds to table 2-34 of ITU H.222.0 | ISO/IEC 13818-1

parameter.parameter_description: ISO/IEC 14496-3 Audio with the LATM transport syntax as defined in ISO/IEC 14496-3

parameter.name: GST_MPEGTS_STREAM_TYPE_SL_FLEXMUX_PES_PACKETS
parameter.parameter_description: ISO/IEC 14496-1 SL-packetized stream or FlexMux stream carried in PES packets

parameter.name: GST_MPEGTS_STREAM_TYPE_SL_FLEXMUX_SECTIONS
parameter.parameter_description: ISO/IEC 14496-1 SL-packetized stream or FlexMux stream carried in ISO/IEC 14496_sections

parameter.name: GST_MPEGTS_STREAM_TYPE_METADATA_DATA_CAROUSEL
parameter.parameter_description: Metadata carried in ISO/IEC 13818-6 Data Carousel

parameter.name: GST_MPEGTS_STREAM_TYPE_METADATA_OBJECT_CAROUSEL
parameter.parameter_description: Metadata carried in ISO/IEC 13818-6 Object Carousel

parameter.name: GST_MPEGTS_STREAM_TYPE_METADATA_SYNCHRONIZED_DOWNLOAD
parameter.parameter_description: Metadata carried in ISO/IEC 13818-6 Synchronized Download Protocol

parameter.name: GST_MPEGTS_STREAM_TYPE_MPEG2_IPMP
parameter.parameter_description: IPMP stream (defined in ISO/IEC 13818-11, MPEG-2 IPMP)

parameter.name: GST_MPEGTS_STREAM_TYPE_VIDEO_H264
parameter.parameter_description: AVC video stream conforming to one or more profiles defined in Annex A of Rec. ITU-T H.264 | ISO/IEC 14496-10 or AVC video sub-bitstream of SVC as defined in 2.1.78 or MVC base view sub-bitstream, as defined in 2.1.85, or AVC video sub-bitstream of MVC, as defined in 2.1.88

parameter.name: GST_MPEGTS_STREAM_TYPE_AUDIO_AAC_CLEAN
parameter.parameter_description: ISO/IEC 14496-3 Audio, without using any additional transport syntax, such as DST, ALS and SLS

parameter.name: GST_MPEGTS_STREAM_TYPE_VIDEO_RVC

parameter.name: GST_MPEGTS_STREAM_TYPE_VIDEO_H264_SVC_SUB_BITSTREAM

parameter.name: GST_MPEGTS_STREAM_TYPE_VIDEO_JP2K

function.name: advance_period
function.description: Advances the manifest to the next period. New streams should be created using gst_adaptive_demux_stream_new().

function.name: data_received
function.description: Notifies the subclass that a fragment chunk was downloaded. The subclass can look at the data at the adapter and modify/push data as desired.
function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK if successful, #GST_FLOW_ERROR in case of error.

function.name: dvb_text_from_utf8
function.description:
Converts UTF-8 strings to text characters compliant with EN 300 468. The converted text can be used directly in DVB #GstMpegtsDescriptor
The function will try different character maps until the string is completely converted.
The function tries the default ISO 6937 character map first.
If no character map that contains all characters could be found, the string is converted to ISO 6937 with unknown characters set to `?`.

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: The text to convert. This should be in UTF-8 format

parameter.name: out_size
parameter.parameter_description: the byte length of the new text

function.name: finish_fragment
function.description: Notifies the subclass that a fragment download was finished. It can be used to cleanup internal state after a fragment and also push any pending data before moving to the next fragment.

function.name: get_live_seek_range
function.description:
Gets the allowed seek start and stop positions for the current live stream
Return: %TRUE if successful

parameter.name: start
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to put the start position allowed to seek to

parameter.name: stop
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to put the stop position allowed to seek to

function.name: get_manifest_update_interval
function.description: Used during live streaming, the subclass should return the interval between successive manifest updates

function.name: get_presentation_offset
gst_aggregator_finish_buffer
function.description: This method will push the provided output buffer downstream. If needed, mandatory events such as stream-start, caps, and segment events will be sent before pushing the buffer.

function.name: gst_aggregator_get_latency
function.description:
Retrieves the latency values reported by @self in response to the latency query, or %GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE if there is not live source connected and the element will not wait for the clock.
Typically only called by subclasses.
function.return: The latency or %GST_CLOCK_TIME_NONE if the element does not sync

function.name: gst_aggregator_iterate_sinkpads
function.description:
Iterate the sinkpads of aggregator to call a function on them.
This method guarantees that @func will be called only once for each sink pad.

function.name: gst_aggregator_merge_tags
function.description:
Adds tags to so-called pending tags, which will be processed before pushing out data downstream.
Note that this is provided for convenience, and the subclass is not required to use this and can still do tag handling on its own.
MT safe.

function.name: gst_aggregator_pad_drop_buffer
function.description: Drop the buffer currently queued in @pad.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the pad where to drop any pending buffer

function.return: TRUE if there was a buffer queued in @pad, or FALSE if not.

function.name: gst_aggregator_pad_get_buffer

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the pad to get buffer from

function.return: A reference to the buffer in @pad or NULL if no buffer was queued. You should unref the buffer after usage.

function.name: gst_aggregator_pad_steal_buffer
function.description: Steal the ref to the buffer currently queued in @pad.

parameter.name: pad
parameter.parameter_description: the pad to get buffer from

function.return: The buffer in @pad or NULL if no buffer was queued. You should unref the buffer after usage.

function.name: gst_aggregator_set_latency
function.description: Lets #GstAggregator sub-classes tell the baseclass what their internal latency is. Will also post a LATENCY message on the bus so the pipeline can reconfigure its global latency.

function.name: gst_aggregator_set_src_caps
function.description: Sets the caps to be used on the src pad.

parameter.name: caps
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstCaps to set on the src pad.

function.name: gst_base_camera_src_set_mode
function.description: Set the chosen #GstCameraBinMode capture mode.

function.name: gst_gl_context_activate
function.description:
(De)activate the OpenGL context represented by this @context.
In OpenGL terms, calls eglMakeCurrent or similar with this context and the currently set window. See gst_gl_context_set_window() for details.

function.name: gst_gl_context_can_share
function.description: Note: This will always fail for two wrapped #GstGLContext's
function.return: whether @context and @other_context are able to share OpenGL resources.

function.name: gst_gl_context_check_feature
function.description: Some features require that the context be created before it is possible to determine their existence and so will fail if that is not the case.

function.name: gst_gl_context_check_gl_version
function.return: whether OpenGL context implements the required api and specified version.

function.name: gst_gl_context_create
function.description:
Creates an OpenGL context in the current thread with the specified @other_context as a context to share shareable OpenGL objects with. See the OpenGL specification for what is shared between contexts.
If an error occurs, and @error is not %NULL, then error will contain details of the error and %FALSE will be returned.
Should only be called once.

parameter.name: other_context
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstGLContext to share OpenGL objects with

function.return: whether the context could successfully be created

function.name: gst_gl_context_destroy
function.description:
Destroys an OpenGL context.
Should only be called after gst_gl_context_create() has been successfully called for this context.

function.name: gst_gl_context_fill_info
function.description: Fills @context's info (version, extensions, vtable, etc) from the GL context in the current thread. Typically used with wrapped contexts to allow wrapped contexts to be used as regular #GstGLContext's.

function.name: gst_gl_context_get_current
function.description: See also gst_gl_context_activate().
function.return: the #GstGLContext active in the current thread or %NULL

function.name: gst_gl_context_get_current_gl_api
function.description: If an error occurs, @major and @minor aren't modified and %GST_GL_API_NONE is returned.

parameter.name: platform
parameter.parameter_description: the #GstGLPlatform to retreive the API for

function.return: The version supported by the OpenGL context current in the calling thread or %GST_GL_API_NONE

function.name: gst_gl_context_get_current_gl_context

parameter.name: context_type
parameter.parameter_description: a #GstGLPlatform specifying the type of context to retrieve

function.return: The OpenGL context handle current in the calling thread or %NULL

function.name: gst_gl_context_get_gl_api

Get the currently enabled OpenGL api.
The currently available API may be limited by the #GstGLDisplay in use and/or the #GstGLWindow chosen.

function.return: The platform specific backing OpenGL context

function.name: gst_gl_context_get_gl_platform
function.description: Gets the OpenGL platform that used by @context.
function.return: The platform specific backing OpenGL context

function.name: gst_gl_context_get_gl_version
gst_gl_context_get_proc_address

Get a function pointer to a specified opengl function, @name. If the the specific function does not exist, NULL is returned instead.
Platform specfic functions (names starting 'egl', 'glX', 'wgl', etc) can also be retrieved using this method.

MT-safe

whether @context was successfully added. %FALSE may be returned if there already exists another context for @context's active thread.

function.name: gst_gl_display_filter_gl_api
function.description: limit the use of OpenGL to the requested @gl_api. This is intended to allow application and elements to request a specific set of OpenGL API's based on what they support. See gst_gl_context_get_gl_api() for the retreiving the API supported by a #GstGLContext.

the #GstGLContext current on @thread or %NULL

function.name: gst_gl_download_perform
function.description:
Downloads the contents of @inbuf into @outbuf.
The output buffer contents must match the #GstVideoFormat passed to gst_gl_download_set_format(), and the input buffer must contain #GstGLMemory memory items.
This method supports downloading multiple views.

function.name: gst_gl_download_perform_with_data
function.description:
Downloads @texture_id into @data. @data size and format is specified by the #GstVideoFormat passed to gst_gl_download_set_format()
This method can only be used for download a single view.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: where the downloaded data should go

function.name: gst_gl_download_set_format
function.description: Initializes @download with the information required for download.

function.name: gst_gl_filter_draw_texture
function.description: Draws @texture into the OpenGL scene at the specified @width and @height.

function.name: gst_gl_filter_filter_texture
function.description: Perform automatic upload if needed, call filter_texture vfunc and then an automatic download if needed.

function.name: gst_gl_filter_render_to_target
function.description: Transforms @input into @output using @func on through FBO. @resize should only ever be %TRUE whenever @input is the input texture of @filter.

parameter.name: resize
parameter.parameter_description: whether to automatically resize the texture between the input size and the output size

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: the function to transform @input into @output. called with @data

function.name: gst_gl_filter_render_to_target_with_shader
function.description:
Transforms @input into @output using @shader on FBO. @resize should only ever be %TRUE whenever @input is the input texture of @filter.
See also: gst_gl_filter_render_to_target()

parameter.name: resize
parameter.parameter_description: whether to automatically resize the texture between the input size and the output size

function.name: gst_gl_memory_alloc
function.description: Allocated a new #GstGlMemory.

parameter.name: plane
parameter.parameter_description: the plane this memory will represent

function.return: a #GstMemory object with a GL texture specified by @vinfo from @context

function.name: gst_gl_memory_copy_into_texture
function.description:
Copies @gl_mem into the texture specfified by @tex_id. The format of @tex_id is specified by @tex_type, @width and @height.
If @respecify is %TRUE, then the copy is performed in terms of the texture data. This is useful for splitting RGBA textures into RG or R textures or vice versa. The requirement for this to succeed is that the backing texture data must be the same size, i.e. say a RGBA8 texture is converted into a RG8 texture, then the RG texture must have twice as many pixels available for output as the RGBA texture.
Otherwise, if @respecify is %FALSE, then the copy is performed per texel using glCopyTexImage. See the OpenGL specification for details on the mappings between texture formats.

parameter.name: stride
parameter.parameter_description: stride of the backing texture data

parameter.name: respecify
parameter.parameter_description: whether to copy the data or copy per texel

function.name: gst_gl_memory_init
function.description: Initializes the GL Memory allocator. It is safe to call this function multiple times. This must be called before any other GstGLMemory operation.

parameter.name: notify

function.return: whether the memory's were sucessfully created.

function.name: gst_h263_parse
function.description:
Parses @data and fills @packet with the information of the next packet found.
Note that the type of the packet is meaningless in this case.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: offset from which to start the parsing

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: The size of the @data to parse

function.name: gst_h264_nal_parser_free
function.description: Frees @nalparser and sets it to %NULL

function.name: gst_h264_nal_parser_new
function.description: Creates a new #GstH264NalParser. It should be freed with gst_h264_nal_parser_free after use.

function.name: gst_h264_parse_pps
function.description:
Parses @data, and fills the @pps structure.
The resulting @pps data structure shall be deallocated with the gst_h264_pps_clear() function when it is no longer needed, or prior to parsing a new PPS NAL unit.

function.name: gst_h264_parse_sps
function.description: Parses @data, and fills the @sps structure.

parameter.name: parse_vui_params
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to parse the vui_params or not

function.name: gst_h264_parse_subset_sps
function.description:
Parses @data, and fills in the @sps structure.
This function fully parses @data and allocates all the necessary data structures needed for MVC extensions. The resulting @sps structure shall be deallocated with gst_h264_sps_clear() when it is no longer needed.
Note: if the caller doesn't need any of the MVC-specific data, then gst_h264_parser_parse_sps() is more efficient because those extra syntax elements are not parsed and no extra memory is allocated.

parameter.name: parse_vui_params
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to parse the vui_params or not

Parses @data and fills @nalu from the next nalu data from @data.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: the offset from which to parse @data

parameter.name: nalu
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstH264NalUnit where to store parsed nal headers

function.name: gst_h264_video_calculate_framerate

Calculate framerate of a video sequence using @sps VUI information, @field_pic_flag from a slice header and @pic_struct from #GstH264PicTiming SEI message.
If framerate is variable or can't be determined, @fps_num will be set to 0 and @fps_den to 1.

parameter.name: field_pic_flag
parameter.parameter_description: Current @field_pic_flag, obtained from latest slice header

parameter.name: huf_tables
parameter.parameter_description: The default DC/AC Huffman tables to fill in

parameter.parameter_description: The default luma/chroma quant-tables in zigzag mode

function.name: gst_jpeg_parse
function.description:
Parses the JPEG bitstream contained in @data, and returns the detected segment as a #GstJpegSegment.
Note that a valid segment may be returned with a length that exceeds the available data. It is up to the caller to make sure there's enough data available when parsing the segment.

parameter.name: segment
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to a #GstJpegSegment structure to fill in

parameter.name: offset
parameter.parameter_description: The offset from which to start parsing

function.return: TRUE if a packet start code was found.

function.name: gst_jpeg_segment_parse_frame_header
function.description:
Parses the @frame_hdr JPEG frame header structure members from @segment.
The caller must make sure there is enough data for the whole segment available.
function.return: TRUE if the frame header was correctly parsed.

function.name: gst_jpeg_segment_parse_huffman_table
function.return: TRUE if the Huffman table was correctly parsed.

function.name: gst_jpeg_segment_parse_quantization_table
function.description:
Parses the JPEG quantization table structure members from @segment.
The caller must make sure there is enough data for the whole segment available.
Note: @quant_tables represents the complete set of possible quantization tables. However, the parser will only write to the quantization table specified by the table destination identifier (Tq). While doing so, the @valid flag of the specified quantization table will also be set to %TRUE.
function.return: TRUE if the quantization table was correctly parsed.

function.name: gst_jpeg_segment_parse_restart_interval
function.description: The caller must make sure there is enough data for the whole segment available.
function.return: TRUE if the restart interval value was correctly parsed.

function.name: gst_jpeg_segment_parse_scan_header
function.description:
Parses the @scan_hdr JPEG scan header structure members from @segment.
The caller must make sure there is enough data for the whole segment available.
function.return: TRUE if the scan header was correctly parsed

function.name: gst_mpegts_section_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GstMpegtsSection from the provided @data.
Note: Ensuring @data is big enough to contain the full section is the responsibility of the caller. If it is not big enough, %NULL will be returned.
Note: it is the responsibility of the caller to ensure @data does point to the beginning of the section.

parameter.name: pid
parameter.parameter_description: the PID to which this section belongs

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the beginning of the section (i.e. the first byte should contain the table_id field).

function.return: A new #GstMpegtsSection if the data was valid, else %NULL

function.name: gst_mpegts_section_packetize
function.description: If the data in @section has already been packetized, the data pointer is returned immediately. Otherwise, the data field is allocated and populated.

parameter.name: output_size
parameter.parameter_description: #gsize to hold the size of the data

function.return: pointer to section data, or %NULL on fail

function.name: gst_mpegts_section_send_event
function.description: Creates a custom #GstEvent with a @GstMpegtsSection. The #GstEvent is sent to the @element #GstElement.

parameter.name: element
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstElement to send to section event to

parameter.name: section
parameter.parameter_description: The #GstMpegtsSection to put in the event

function.name: gst_vp8_parser_parse_frame_header
function.description: Parses the VP8 bitstream contained in @data, and fills in @frame_hdr with the information. The supplied @data shall point to a complete frame since there is no sync code specified for VP8 bitstreams. Thus, the @size argument shall represent the whole frame size.

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: The size of the @data to parse

function.name: gst_wayland_video_begin_geometry_change
function.description:
Notifies the video sink that we are about to change its geometry (probably using set_render_rectangle()). This is useful in order to allow the sink to synchronize resizing/moving of the video area with the parent surface and avoid glitches, in cases where the video area is being painted asynchronously from another thread, like in waylandsink.
Please note that any calls to this method MUST be matched by calls to end_geometry_change() and AFTER the parent surface has commited its geometry changes.

function.name: gst_wayland_video_end_geometry_change
function.description:
Notifies the video sink that we just finished changing the geometry of both itself and its parent surface. This should have been earlier preceeded by a call to begin_geometry_change() which notified the sink before any of these changes had happened.
It is important to call this method only AFTER the parent surface has commited its geometry changes, otherwise no synchronization is actually achieved.

function.name: has_next_period
function.description: Checks if there is a next period following the current one. DASH can have multiple medias chained in its manifest, when one finishes this function is called to verify if there is a new period to be played in sequence.

function.name: reset
function.description: Reset the internal state of the subclass, getting ready to restart with a new stream afterwards

function.name: seek
function.description: The demuxer should seek on all its streams to the specified position in the seek event

function.name: start_fragment
function.description: Notifies the subclass that the given stream is starting the download of a new fragment. Can be used to reset/init internal state that is needed before each fragment, like decryption engines.

function.name: stream_get_fragment_waiting_time
function.description: For live streams, requests how much time should be waited before starting to download the fragment. This is useful to avoid downloading a fragment that isn't available yet.

function.name: stream_select_bitrate
function.description: The stream should try to select the bitrate that is the greater, but not greater than the requested bitrate. If it needs a codec change it should create the new stream using gst_adaptive_demux_stream_new(). If it only needs a caps change it should set the new caps using gst_adaptive_demux_stream_set_caps().

parameter.name: bitrate
parameter.parameter_description: the bitrate to select (in bytes per second)

function.return: #TRUE if the stream changed bitrate, #FALSE otherwise

function.name: stream_update_fragment_info
function.description: Requests the stream to set the information about the current fragment to its current fragment struct
function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK in success, #GST_FLOW_ERROR on error and #GST_FLOW_EOS if there is no fragment.

function.name: update_manifest
function.description: During live streaming, this will be called for the subclass to update its manifest with the new version. By default it fetches the manifest URI and passes it to GstAdaptiveDemux::update_manifest_data().
function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK is all succeeded, #GST_FLOW_EOS if the stream ended or #GST_FLOW_ERROR if an error happened

function.name: update_manifest_data
function.description: During live streaming, this will be called for the subclass to update its manifest with the new version
function.return: #GST_FLOW_OK is all succeeded, #GST_FLOW_EOS if the stream ended or #GST_FLOW_ERROR if an error happened
